column1: Talegaon Dabhade is a town in Mawal Taluka
column3: in the Indian state of Maharashtra. It is 120 km (75 mi) from Mumbai and 35 km (22 mi) from Pune.

column2: Talegaon Dabhade had a population of 42
column3: 574. Males constituted 53% of the population and females 47%. The average literacy rate was 79%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy was 83%
column5: and female literacy was 75%. At that time
column6: 11% of the population was under 6 years of age.At the 2011 Census of India

column1: Talegaon has a railway station which serves as a terminus for trains running on the Pune Suburban Railway. The station is of two platforms and has four tracks with two footbridges. This serves access to Talegaon Dabhade village and General Motors
column2: Pune plant. PMPMLbus service is available.Private taxies are also available.
